urlLink Everyone should check out the above link. It's about a private company that is the first to send a man into space. It had nothing to do with the U.S. Government and it supposedly costed a fraction less than what NASA pays to put a man into space. This whole thing is supposed to work towards researching the possibility of space tourism. I think this is a pretty cool idea, to send people to space for money. But the cost is incredible, you have to be some kinda rich to be able to buy a ride to space. Costs are predicted to be about $100,000. Keep in mind this is in the next 50 years as well, because the technology is not ready for "regular consumer use." What regular consumer has $100,000 to spend to go to outer space? For $100,000 dollars, here's what you get. - A 90 minute space ship ride that is extremely demanding physically. - About 3 minutes of actual space time. - Possibility of death. - A package of M&M's to throw around, in case you get bored while your there. - You will be famous for a few days. I like the idea...if anyone has some spare money they'd like to give me so I can enjoy a trip to outer space, you can contact me at nicklasvishnov@netscape.net. P.S. - Prices are predicted to decrease DRASTICALLY after the introduction of high capacity spacecraft. Prices are supposed to be in the $40,000 range. At least we have something to look forward to.
